result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Charles Blackdeer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Sawyer County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: $518.00   Pay obligation within 60 days or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 60 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.

220 DAYS IN COUNTY JAIL WITH GOOD TIME, AND WORK RELEASE CREDIT FOR 31 DAYS TIME SERVED.
Consecutive to: 14 CF 172

Defendant Joseph Charles Blackdeer in court with attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore.  Defendant Joseph Charles Blackdeer in custody.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Guilty plea entered.  Court finds defendant guilty.

COURT:  Sawyer County jail for 220 days with huber if meets the standards that the jail has and good time, credit for 31 days time served and to run consecutive to sentence serving in 14 CF 172 - Costs 
   Bond OF $500.00 to be applied towards costs and balance to be returned to person who posted it

PD appointment of attorney

Defendant Joseph Charles Blackdeer in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Moldenhauer states client would like a new attorney.
Court reluctantly grants request. Atty Moldenhauer released, court requests he let the Public Defender's office know.
Court also informs DEF to call Public Defender's office.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
